title.text: Adapting Existing Grammars: The XLE Experience

abstractContent.text: We report on the XLE parser and grammar development platform (Maxwell and Kaplan, 1993) and describe how a basic Lexical Functional Grammar for English has been adapted to two different corpora (newspaper text and copier repair tips).

introductionContent.text: Large-scale grammar development platforms should be able to be used to develop grammars fora wide variety of purposes.
In this paper, we report on the the XLE system (, a parser and grammar development platform for Lexical Functional Grammars.
We describe some of the strategies and notational devices that enable the basic English grammar developed for the ParGram project () to be adapted to two corpora with different properties.
